description: UMD 2.6.0 is the 8th update of second Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release supports both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 as also Debian 6 (Squeeze).
releaseNotes: <div>This release contains the following products:</div><div><b>EMI Technology Provider:</b></div><div>Job Execution services:<br></div><br><div>UNICORE/X6 5.1.0 &nbsp;release in SL5, SL6 and Debian:</div><div><ul><li>This release provides several bug-fixes together with some new functionality like the metadata crawler (i.e. include exclude files) and also a improved information in case of errors from a job.</li></ul></div><div>UNICORE TSI6 5.1.0 release in SL5, SL6 and Debian:</div><div><ul><li>This is an update release of the TSI providing fixes for the resource reservation support in Maui/Torque and adding an implementation of resource reservation for Slurm.</li></ul></div><div>EMI-WN 2.0.1 released in SL5 and SL6:</div><div><ul><li>Simple repacking no new functionality</li></ul></div><div>Client Tools:</div><div>GFAL/lcg_util 1.15.0 released in SL5 and SL6</div><div><ul><li>This releases present several bug-fixes namely for the lcg-gt and lcg-cp commands.</li></ul></div><div>gLExec-WN 1.1.2 released in SL5 and SL6:</div><div><ul><li>fix bug in -t option preventing it from working.</li></ul><div><div>EMI-UI 2.0.2-1 released in SL5 and SL6:</div><div><ul><li>This release adds dependencies on both gsi-openssh-clients and glite-ce-monitor-cli and also solves and and important issue on cream-cli on which the Character "=" would causes a crash of a submit job.<br></li></ul></div></div></div>
installationNotes: <div><div>All products in the UMD 2.6.0 release were verified against EGI's current Quality Criteria (for further information, please see the documentation links) to support 64 bit Scientific Linux 5 and Scientific Linux 6 (x86_64 processor architecture). Some products are also supported in 64 bit Debian 6 (squeeze). &nbsp;Installation and configuration notes are available in the EGI repository.</div></div><br/>
contact: For further information about the UMD, its goals and surrounding processes, and more information about how to engage as a Technology Provider with EGI, please send an Email to: cto (at) egi.eu.
technicalContact: <div>For any bugs and issues you encounter that are not described in the release notes of this UMD release, or the related documentation provided by the Technology Providers, please visit the EGI Helpdesk to make a report.</div><br/>
knownIssues: <div>Details containing known issues and workarounds found in EGI verification and staged rollout are collected in:<a href="https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-2:UMD-2.6.0"> https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-2:UMD-2.6.0</a></div><br/>
changeLog: <div>This releases includes updates for the following products:<br><ul><li>gLExec-WN<br></li><li>emi-wn<br></li><li>UNICORE/X6<br></li><li>UNICORE TSI6<br></li><li>GFAL/lcg_util<br></li></ul></div>

products.name: emi.emi-ui
products.releaseNotes:
added dependencies on:

gsi-openssh-clients and glite-ce-monitor-cli

fixing an important issue on cream-cli:

Character "=" causes a crash in jobsubmit

products.name: emi.emi-wn
products.releaseNotes:
added dependencies on:

        openldap-clients python-ldap glite-lb-client-progs perl-dpm perl-lfc dpm-devel lfc-devel

        32b clients for DPM, LFC, GFAL/lcg_util

    For more details on the changes introduces by the new clients please read the Release Notes of DPM/LFC v. 1.8.4 and GFAL/lcg_util v. 1.13.9



    new version of the EMI WN documentation containing more details regarding client provided, installation and configuration
products.changeLog:
added dependencies on:

        openldap-clients python-ldap glite-lb-client-progs perl-dpm perl-lfc dpm-devel lfc-devel

        32b clients for DPM, LFC, GFAL/lcg_util

    For more details on the changes introduces by the new clients please read the Release Notes of DPM/LFC v. 1.8.4 and GFAL/lcg_util v. 1.13.9



    new version of the EMI WN documentation containing more details regarding client provided, installation and configuration

products.name: emi.gfal-lcg_util
products.description: GFAL (Grid File Access Library ) is a C library providing an abstraction layer of the grid storage system complexity. The version 2.0 of GFAL tries to simplify at the maximum the file operations in a distributed environment. the complexity of the grid is hidden from the client side behind a simple common POSIX API. GFAL 2.0 is able to manage all the common used file access protocols in a grid environment Dcap GSIDCAP, LFN RFIO ( DPM or CASTOR ) SRM, GridFTP, HTTP/WebDav-

products.name: emi.glexec-wn
products.description: gLExec is a program that acts as a light-weight 'gatekeeper'. gLExec takes Grid credentials as input. gLExec takes the local site policy into account to authenticate and authorize the credentials. gLExec will switch to a new execution sandbox and execute the given command as the switched identity. gLExec is also capable of functioning as a light-weight control point which offers a binary yes/no result called the logging-only mode.
products.releaseNotes:
Update for mkgltempdir:

fix bug in -t option preventing it from working.

improvement: the -t option only runs gLExec once.

products.name: emi.unicore-tsi6
products.description: The UNICORE TSI is a Perl daemon running on the frontend of the target resource (e.g. a cluster login node). It provides a remote interface to the operating system, the batch system and the file system of the target resource. It is used by the UNICORE/X server to perform tasks on the target resource, such as submitting and monitoring jobs, handling data, managing directories etc.
products.releaseNotes:
This is an update release of the TSI providing fixes for the resource reservation support in Maui/Torque and adding an implementation of resource reservation for Slurm.

Additionally there are some fixes in the NOBATCH module.
products.changeLog:
This is an update release of the TSI providing fixes for the resource reservation support in Maui/Torque and adding an implementation of resource reservation for Slurm.

Additionally there are some fixes in the NOBATCH module.

products.name: emi.unicorex6
products.description:
The UNICORE/X server is the central component of a UNICORE site. It hosts the services such

as job submission, job management, storage access, and provides the bridge to the functionality

of the target resources, e.g. batch systems or ﬁle systems.
products.releaseNotes:
This release is backwards compatible. The list of changes:

storages publish a list of server-to-server transfers (SF enhancements #3468402)

- fix: requesting a non-existent execution environment did not leadto failed a job (SF bug #3487520)

- new feature: metadata crawler (i.e. include exclude files) can be controlled using a special file in the base directory

- new feature: in case of errors, get detailed information about a job from the batch system (SF improvements #3405627)

- improvement/fix: pass on user-set job name to TSI (TSI_JOBNAME) (SF improvements #3514589)

- new feature: server-server transfer rate is published in file transfer properties (SF improvements #3474321)

- improvement: enabled file transfer protocols are update dynamicallywhere possible (SF improvements #3462887)

- improvement: refactored Security information RP (showing client's xlogins, groups, server's accepted VOs and trusted CAs)

- improvement: assignment of requests to VOs (SF improvements #3495695)

- add support for the EMI registry (see docs/unicorex/emir.txt)
